question:
Which among the following is/are the element(s) of a State?
a. Population
b. Territory
c. Government
d. Sovereignty
explanation:
A  State is identified by its constituent elements which include the following -
a. Population - State is a human institution and population is an essential element of the state.
b. Territory - State must possess a territory where its authority is accepted without dispute or challenge.
c. Government - Government is the agency or machinery of state through which common interest of people is promoted.
d. Sovereignty - It is an essential element because it denotes the supreme or ultimate power of the state to make laws for the area under its territory.
